text: John Mág Tighearnán, the First, (anglicised John McKiernan) was chief of the McKiernan Clan of Tullyhunco, County Cavan until his death in 1499.C. Parker, “Two minor septs of late medieval Breifne”, in Breifne Journal, Vol. VIII, No. 31 (1995), pp. 566–586 ==Chieftainship== On the death of the previous chief, John took the chieftaincy and resided in the castle of Croaghan of the Cups (Irish- Cruachan O'Cúbhrán), now in the townland of Coolnashinny, beside the later town of Killeshandra. In 1495 a relative died. The Annals of Ulster for 1495 state- Mag Tighernain ‘Ichtarach’, namely, Gormgal, son of Brian Mag Tigernain, died ==Death== John died in 1499. The Annals of Ulster for 1499 state- Mag Tighernain of Tellach-Dunchadha, namely, John Mag Tighernain, died this year. ==References== Category:Irish lords Category:1499 deaths Category:People from County Cavan Category:15th-century Irish people
title: John Mág Tighearnán
